prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: A new lawyer at the agency. She's been arrested as the suspect in the case.
Character 1
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: Currently working on his own. He says he wants to bring his friend's killer to justice, but I wonder if that's all.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.
Character 3
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of Apollo's.
Character 4
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. I defended her when she was on trial for the courtroom bombing incident.
Character 5
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case.[1] He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 6
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: Convicted of the murder at the Space Center seven years ago. He's chasing a phantom he saw back then.
Character 7
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 8
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 9
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 10
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 11
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 12
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Character 13
Name: Metis Cykes
Description: Athena's mother and victim of the murder seven years ago. She was a talented psychologist like her daughter.
Character 14
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.
Character 15
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The chief prosecutor. He's an old friend and a former prosecutor against whom I fought many courtroom battles.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.
Evidence 1
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 2
Name: Utility Knife
Description: It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs. The murder weapon in this case. Athena also used one of these to stab the phantom's hand during the incident seven years ago.
Evidence 3
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 4
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples. It was at the crime scene seven years ago. It was launched into space and only returned to Earth a few days ago.
Evidence 5
Name: HAT-1 Exhibit
Description: A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and a jacket one of them wore. A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and the jacket worn by Dr. Cykes.
Evidence 6
Name: Katana
Description: The weapon used in the murder seven years ago. It belonged to the victim. The victim's blood was found only on the blade.
Evidence 7
Name: Seven-Year-Old Video
Description: Video showing the corridor to the crime scene. Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Photo of the Crime
Description: Taken inadvertently. It became conclusive evidence at Simon Blackquill's trial seven years ago. The photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart. There's a bloodstain at the end of the robot's arm.
Evidence 9
Name: Seven-Year-Old Photos
Description: Two photos of the body and crime scene. They were taken by the first person to discover the body. [caption] The victim is lying on the operating table. On the other side of the room is a workbench. The victim's clothes are drenched in blood.
Evidence 10
Name: Metis's Autopsy Report
Description: The cause of death was a stab wound to the chest. The weapon pierced the heart and so death was instantaneous.
Evidence 11
Name: Robots with a Heart
Description: It explains the recognition and communication features of the Ponco series of Robots.
Evidence 12
Name: Moon Rock Earring
Description: An earring that Dr. Cykes gave to Athena. The stone was cut from a real moon rock that was being used for research.
Evidence 13
Name: Phantom's Psych Profile
Description: The subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't experience feelings like normal people do.
Evidence 14
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 16
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.) The biometric door lock. Print authentication isn't required from the launch pad side. (2 pages.)
Evidence 17
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 18
Name: Lighter
Description: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood. A lighter that can transform into a handgun. It has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood on it.
Evidence 19
Name: Emergency Ladder
Description: It was lowered to the ground from the window of the fourth-floor robotics lab. It was used to evacuate Space Center personnel.
Evidence 20
Name: Phony Phanty Bomb
Description: It was found in Boarding Lounge 1 and detonated in Courtroom No. 4. Fragments are being analyzed. (2 pages.)

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the robotics lab at about 2 PM for my regular recharge!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 1
Testimony: Just as I was about to charge up, Athena came in and hugged Mommy Metis!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 2
Testimony: And then Mommy Metis fell down. After that, I was recharging, so I don't know anything.
Person: Ponco
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mommy Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room!
Person: Ponco
Testimony 4
Testimony: After I charged up, I was cleaning the room, and Mr. Simon came in.
Person: Ponco
Testimony 5
Testimony: And then an error occurred. There is no data after that point.
Person: Ponco

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find a contradiction between the evidence and testimonies, we need to analyze both the evidence descriptions and the testimonies provided. We will use logical reasoning to determine if any pair has information that conflicts.

**Step 1: Understand the Key Points in Testimonies**

- **Ponco Testimony 0:** Ponco went to the robotics lab at about 2 PM for a recharge.
- **Ponco Testimony 1:** Athena came into the lab and hugged Mommy Metis.
- **Ponco Testimony 2:** After the hug, Mommy Metis fell, Ponco was recharging, and does not know anything after.
- **Ponco Testimony 3:** Metis fell near the round window on the workbench side of the room.
- **Ponco Testimony 4:** After recharging, Ponco was cleaning the room, and Simon (Blackquill) came in.
- **Ponco Testimony 5:** An error occurred post-recharging; there is no data beyond this point.

**Step 2: Analyzing Relevant Evidence**

- **Evidence 10 (Metis's Autopsy Report):** Metis Cykes died from a stab wound to the chest, leading to instantaneous death.
- **Evidence 9 (Seven-Year-Old Photos):** Photos of the crime scene show the victim's clothes drenched in blood on an operating table.

**Step 3: Look for Contradictions**

We will look for mismatched elements between the testimonies and the pieces of evidence:

- **Ponco Testimony 3** says Metis fell down near the round window on the workbench side of the room, but according to **Evidence 9** (Seven-Year-Old Photos), Metis was lying on an operating table, indicating Metis might not have fallen near that particular spot. 

This suggests a possible contradiction: if the crime scene photos indicate Metis was on the operating table, how could she have fallen by the workbench side according to Ponco's testimony?

Let's conclude our examination with this finding.

{"evidence": 9, "testimony": 3}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find the contradiction, let's first examine the provided evidence and testimonies in detail. We’re looking for details that don’t align or make sense when considered together.

We have evidence:

- **Evidence 18: Lighter**: Found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's fingerprints and the victim's blood on it. It can transform into a handgun. It also has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood.

And testimonies:

- **Testimony 3**: Detective Fulbright claims to have proof that Athena Cykes is the culprit with a lighter that has her prints on it.

In evidence 18, it is stated that although the lighter has Athena's prints, it also possesses Clay Terran's prints and blood. This detail introduces ambiguity and contradicts Fulbright’s assertion in Testimony 3 that the presence of Athena’s prints on the lighter definitively proves her guilt. The information about the victim’s prints and blood on the lighter suggests alternative possibilities, such as someone else using or fabricating the evidence (especially since the lighter can transform into a handgun).

Therefore, the contradiction lies in Fulbright's testimony claiming the lighter definitively incriminates Athena when the evidence implies further investigation is needed due to the presence of the victim’s prints and blood. 

Given this analysis, our contradiction pair is: 

{"evidence": 18, "testimony": 3}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To identify the contradiction between evidence and testimony, let's take a closer look at both the evidence and testimony related to Fulbright and the phantom.

1. **Testimony 3 by Fulbright**: 
   - Testimony: "So the very fact that I'm afraid of the moon rock means I'm not him!"
   - Given testimony: Fulbright is asserting that his fear of the moon rock proves he isn't the phantom.

2. **Relevant Evidence**:
   - **Evidence 1: Space Center Diagram** seems unrelated to Fulbright's testimony.
   - **Evidence 2: Utility Knife** - This evidence mentions Fulbright's statement about the phantom involved in a past case.
   - **Evidence 12: Moon Rock Earring** - This is specifically related to the moon rock, which is the central focus of Fulbright's claim in his testimony. Athena received this earring made from a moon rock.
   - **Evidence 13: Phantom's Psych Profile** - This indicates that the phantom doesn’t experience normal emotions or fear, suggesting someone afraid of the moon rock could not be the phantom.

Let's analyze **Evidence 13: Phantom’s Psych Profile** relative to Fulbright’s claim:

- **Evidence 13**:
  - Description: "The subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't experience feelings like normal people do."

Given Fulbright's testimony (Testimony 3) that being afraid of the moon rock proves he isn’t the phantom, the Phantom's Psych Profile directly contradicts this. If the phantom is someone who doesn't have normal emotional responses (and doesn’t experience fear), then being afraid of the moon rock would indeed contradict being the emotionless phantom.

Therefore, Fulbright’s claim trying to use fear as proof he isn't the phantom is directly contradicted by the evidence that the phantom does not typically experience fear.

With this understanding, the contradiction lies between Fulbright's testimony about his fear and the Phantom’s Psych Profile, which mentions that the phantom does not experience emotions typically like fear.

**Conclusion**:

Fulbright's assertion that he's afraid of the moon rock and thus cannot be the phantom (Testimony 3) is contradicted by the Phantom's Psych Profile (Evidence 13), which suggests the phantom would not experience such fear.

{
  "evidence": 13,
  "testimony": 3
}
